discussion.content:
Another MRUList can be found in the RunMRU key:
HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Software\Microsoft\ Windows\CurrentVersion\Explorer\RunMRU
Entries are added to this key when a user clicks the Start button, chooses Run, and types a command or the name of a file

questions.question_text: Smith, an employee of a reputed forensic investigation firm, has been hired by a private organization to investigate a laptop that is suspected to be involved in the hacking of the organization's DC server. Smith wants to find all the values typed into the Run box in the Start menu. Which of the following registry keys will Smith check to find the above information?

An International Mobile Equipment Identifier (IMEI) is a 15-digit number that indicates the manufacturer, model type, and country of approval for GSM devices. The first eight digits of an IMEI number that provide information about the model and origin of the mobile device is also known as:

discussion.content:
The first eight digits of an IMEI number that provide information about the model and origin of the mobile device are known as:

A. Type Allocation Code (TAC)

The TAC is part of the IMEI and is used to identify the manufacturer and model of the mobile device.
A > The first eight digits, known as the Type Allocation Code (TAC), denote the model and origin of the device

Selected Answer: A
Data Deduplication is not an anti-forensics technique. In fact, it is a data reduction technique that eliminates duplicate copies of data to save storage space.

comments.content: Steganography is indeed an anti-forensics technique. Source: EC Council CHFI book V10

questions.question_text: Which of the following is NOT an anti-forensics technique?
Rusty, a computer forensics apprentice, uses the command nbtstat `"c while analyzing the network information in a suspect system. What information is he looking for?

choices.C: Contents of the NetBIOS name cache
choices.A: Contents of the network routing table

discussion.content:
Rusty is using the command nbtstat -c while analyzing network information. This command displays:

C. Contents of the NetBIOS name cache

The nbtstat -c command shows the NetBIOS name cache, which contains a list of the NetBIOS names and their corresponding IP addresses that the system has resolved.
C > nbtstat -c: displays the contents of the NetBIOS name cache, the table of NetBIOS names and their resolved IP addresses.

Selected Answer: C
C is correct!
C is the right answer. Sending illicit images to children and using offices computer.

Selected Answer: C
This case involves serious criminal allegations of child abuse and the distribution of illicit images, which necessitates a criminal investigation. Additionally, since the alleged activities occurred using office equipment, it also requires an administrative investigation to address potential violations of workplace policies and procedures.

The case described involves allegations of illegal activities, such as abusing children online and sending illicit images, which are criminal in nature. Therefore, it requires:

B. Criminal Investigation

Such allegations involve potential violations of criminal laws, and therefore a criminal investigation is necessary to gather evidence and determine the legality of the activities. Additionally, an administrative investigation may also be conducted by the office or organization to address internal policy violations or disciplinary actions. However, the primary focus would be on the criminal investigation.

questions.question_text:
Gary, a computer technician, is facing allegations of abusing children online by befriending them and sending them illicit adult images from his office computer.
What type of investigation does this case require?
